e4: Switching to the new policy that reports earnings without bias is advisable because it aligns with ethical standards, reduces legal risks, and fosters trust among all investors. Although there might be short-term uncertainty and potential temporary market penalties, the long-term benefits of increased credibility and potential premium on stock price due to higher investor confidence justify the change. Educating investors about the change in reporting practice will be crucial for a smooth transition.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, accurate, and impartial, presenting financial performances honestly without manipulation to mislead stakeholders. It should comply with all relevant laws and regulations, ensuring fairness and equality in investor access to information. Finally, it should involve proactive communication to educate and inform all stakeholders about any changes in reporting practices to avoid confusion and maintain trust, especially when transitioning from a less ethical practice.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in reporting practices to investors effectively. Additionally, I would inquire about what specific measures are being put in place to manage the transition smoothly and any anticipated impacts on stock performance in the short term. Lastly, I would seek clarification on strategies to ensure all stakeholders, especially less sophisticated investors, understand the implications of the new policy.
